verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%>, A Psalm of David <S%H1732><s%>, the servant <S%H5650><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, who spake <S%H1696><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of this song <S%H7892><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> delivered <S%H5337><s%> him from the hand <S%H3709><s%> of all his enemies <S%H341><s%>, and from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%>: And he said <S%H559><s%>, I will love <S%H7355><s%> thee, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, my strength <S%H2391><s%>.

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is my rock <S%H5553><s%>, and my fortress <S%H4686><s%>, and my deliverer <S%H6403><s%>; my God <S%H410><s%>, my strength <S%H6697><s%>, in whom I will trust <S%H2620><s%>; my buckler <S%H4043><s%>, and the horn <S%H7161><s%> of my salvation <S%H3468><s%>, and my high tower <S%H4869><s%>. my strength: Heb. my rock
I will call <S%H7121><s%> upon the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, who is worthy to be praised <S%H1984><s%>: so shall I be saved <S%H3467><s%> from mine enemies <S%H341><s%>.
The sorrows <S%H2256><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%> compassed <S%H661><s%> me, and the floods <S%H5158><s%> of ungodly men <S%H1100><s%> made me afraid <S%H1204><s%>. ungodly men: Heb. Belial
The sorrows <S%H2256><s%> of hell <S%H7585><s%> compassed me about <S%H5437><s%>: the snares <S%H4170><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%> prevented <S%H6923><s%> me. sorrows: or, cords

In my distress <S%H6862><s%> I called <S%H7121><s%> upon the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and cried <S%H7768><s%> unto my God <S%H430><s%>: he heard <S%H8085><s%> my voice <S%H6963><s%> out of his temple <S%H1964><s%>, and my cry <S%H7775><s%> came <S%H935><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him, even into his ears <S%H241><s%>.

Then the earth <S%H776><s%> shook <S%H1607><s%> and trembled <S%H7493><s%>; the foundations <S%H4146><s%> also of the hills <S%H2022><s%> moved <S%H7264><s%> and were shaken <S%H1607><s%>, because he was wroth <S%H2734><s%>.

There went up <S%H5927><s%> a smoke <S%H6227><s%> out of his nostrils <S%H639><s%>, and fire <S%H784><s%> out of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> devoured <S%H398><s%>: coals <S%H1513><s%> were kindled <S%H1197><s%> by it. out of his nostrils: Heb. by his, etc
He bowed <S%H5186><s%> the heavens <S%H8064><s%> also, and came down <S%H3381><s%>: and darkness <S%H6205><s%> was under his feet <S%H7272><s%>.
And he rode <S%H7392><s%> upon a cherub <S%H3742><s%>, and did fly <S%H5774><s%>: yea, he did fly <S%H1675><s%> upon the wings <S%H3671><s%> of the wind <S%H7307><s%>.

He made <S%H7896><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> his secret place <S%H5643><s%>; his pavilion <S%H5521><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%> him were dark <S%H2824><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> and thick clouds <S%H5645><s%> of the skies <S%H7834><s%>.
At the brightness <S%H5051><s%> that was before him his thick clouds <S%H5645><s%> passed <S%H5674><s%>, hail <S%H1259><s%> stones and coals <S%H1513><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%>.

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> also thundered <S%H7481><s%> in the heavens <S%H8064><s%>, and the Highest <S%H5945><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> his voice <S%H6963><s%>; hail <S%H1259><s%> stones and coals <S%H1513><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%>.
Yea, he sent out <S%H7971><s%> his arrows <S%H2671><s%>, and scattered <S%H6327><s%> them; and he shot out <S%H7232><s%> lightnings <S%H1300><s%>, and discomfited <S%H2000><s%> them.

Then the channels <S%H650><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> were seen <S%H7200><s%>, and the foundations <S%H4146><s%> of the world <S%H8398><s%> were discovered <S%H1540><s%> at thy rebuke <S%H1606><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, at the blast <S%H5397><s%> of the breath <S%H7307><s%> of thy nostrils <S%H639><s%>.
He sent <S%H7971><s%> from above <S%H4791><s%>, he took <S%H3947><s%> me, he drew <S%H4871><s%> me out of many <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>. many: or, great
He delivered <S%H5337><s%> me from my strong <S%H5794><s%> enemy <S%H341><s%>, and from them which hated <S%H8130><s%> me: for they were too strong <S%H553><s%> for me.
They prevented <S%H6923><s%> me in the day <S%H3117><s%> of my calamity <S%H343><s%>: but the LORD <S%H3068><s%> was my stay <S%H4937><s%>.
He brought me forth <S%H3318><s%> also into a large place <S%H4800><s%>; he delivered <S%H2502><s%> me, because he delighted <S%H2654><s%> in me.
The LORD <S%H3068><s%> rewarded <S%H1580><s%> me according to my righteousness <S%H6664><s%>; according to the cleanness <S%H1252><s%> of my hands <S%H3027><s%> hath he recompensed <S%H7725><s%> me.
For I have kept <S%H8104><s%> the ways <S%H1870><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and have not wickedly departed <S%H7561><s%> from my God <S%H430><s%>.
For all his judgments <S%H4941><s%> were before me, and I did not put away <S%H5493><s%> his statutes <S%H2708><s%> from me.
I was also upright <S%H8549><s%> before him, and I kept <S%H8104><s%> myself from mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%>. before: Heb. with

Therefore hath the LORD <S%H3068><s%> recompensed <S%H7725><s%> me according to my righteousness <S%H6664><s%>, according to the cleanness <S%H1252><s%> of my hands <S%H3027><s%> in his eyesight <S%H5869><s%>. in: Heb. before his eyes
With the merciful <S%H2623><s%> thou wilt shew thyself merciful <S%H2616><s%>; with an upright <S%H8549><s%> man <S%H1399><s%> thou wilt shew thyself upright <S%H8552><s%>;
With the pure <S%H1305><s%> thou wilt shew thyself pure <S%H1305><s%>; and with the froward <S%H6141><s%> thou wilt shew thyself froward <S%H6617><s%>. shew thyself froward: or, wrestle
For thou wilt save <S%H3467><s%> the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> people <S%H5971><s%>; but wilt bring down <S%H8213><s%> high <S%H7311><s%> looks <S%H5869><s%>.
For thou wilt light <S%H215><s%> my candle <S%H5216><s%>: the LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God <S%H430><s%> will enlighten <S%H5050><s%> my darkness <S%H2822><s%>. candle: or, lamp
For by thee I have run through <S%H7323><s%> a troop <S%H1416><s%>; and by my God <S%H430><s%> have I leaped over <S%H1801><s%> a wall <S%H7791><s%>. run: or, broken

As for God <S%H410><s%>, his way <S%H1870><s%> is perfect <S%H8549><s%>: the word <S%H565><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is tried <S%H6884><s%>: he is a buckler <S%H4043><s%> to all those that trust <S%H2620><s%> in him. tried: or, refined
For who is God <S%H433><s%> save <S%H1107><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>? or who is a rock <S%H6697><s%> save <S%H2108><s%> our God <S%H430><s%>?
It is God <S%H410><s%> that girdeth <S%H247><s%> me with strength <S%H2428><s%>, and maketh <S%H5414><s%> my way <S%H1870><s%> perfect <S%H8549><s%>.
He maketh <S%H7737><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%> like hinds' <S%H355><s%> feet, and setteth <S%H5975><s%> me upon my high places <S%H1116><s%>.
He teacheth <S%H3925><s%> my hands <S%H3027><s%> to war <S%H4421><s%>, so that a bow <S%H7198><s%> of steel <S%H5154><s%> is broken <S%H5181><s%> by mine arms <S%H2220><s%>.

Thou hast also given <S%H5414><s%> me the shield <S%H4043><s%> of thy salvation <S%H3468><s%>: and thy right hand <S%H3225><s%> hath holden me up <S%H5582><s%>, and thy gentleness <S%H6037><s%> hath made me great <S%H7235><s%>. thy gentleness: or, with thy meekness thou hast multiplied me
Thou hast enlarged <S%H7337><s%> my steps <S%H6806><s%> under me, that my feet <S%H7166><s%> did not slip <S%H4571><s%>. my feet: Heb. mine ankles
I have pursued <S%H7291><s%> mine enemies <S%H341><s%>, and overtaken <S%H5381><s%> them: neither did I turn again <S%H7725><s%> till they were consumed <S%H3615><s%>.
I have wounded <S%H4272><s%> them that they were not able <S%H3201><s%> to rise <S%H6965><s%>: they are fallen <S%H5307><s%> under my feet <S%H7272><s%>.

For thou hast girded <S%H247><s%> me with strength <S%H2428><s%> unto the battle <S%H4421><s%>: thou hast subdued <S%H3766><s%> under me those that rose up <S%H6965><s%> against me. subdued: Heb. caused to bow
Thou hast also given <S%H5414><s%> me the necks <S%H6203><s%> of mine enemies <S%H341><s%>; that I might destroy <S%H6789><s%> them that hate <S%H8130><s%> me.
They cried <S%H7768><s%>, but there was none to save <S%H3467><s%> them: even unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, but he answered <S%H6030><s%> them not.

Then did I beat <S%H7833><s%> them small as the dust <S%H6083><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%>: I did cast them out <S%H7324><s%> as the dirt <S%H2916><s%> in the streets <S%H2351><s%>.

Thou hast delivered <S%H6403><s%> me from the strivings <S%H7379><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%>; and thou hast made <S%H7760><s%> me the head <S%H7218><s%> of the heathen <S%H1471><s%>: a people <S%H5971><s%> whom I have not known <S%H3045><s%> shall serve <S%H5647><s%> me.

As soon as they hear <S%H8088><s%> <S%H241><s%> of me, they shall obey <S%H8085><s%> me: the strangers <S%H1121><s%> <S%H5236><s%> shall submit <S%H3584><s%> themselves unto me. As soon: Heb. At the hearing of the ear submit: or, yield feigned obedience strangers: Heb. sons of the stranger
The strangers <S%H1121><s%> <S%H5236><s%> shall fade away <S%H5034><s%>, and be afraid <S%H2727><s%> out of their close places <S%H4526><s%>. strangers: Heb. sons of the stranger
The LORD <S%H3068><s%> liveth <S%H2416><s%>; and blessed <S%H1288><s%> be my rock <S%H6697><s%>; and let the God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation <S%H3468><s%> be exalted <S%H7311><s%>.
It is God <S%H410><s%> that avengeth <S%H5414><s%> <S%H5360><s%> me, and subdueth <S%H1696><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> under me. avengeth: Heb. giveth avengements for subdueth: or, destroyeth

He delivereth <S%H6403><s%> me from mine enemies <S%H341><s%>: yea, thou liftest me up <S%H7311><s%> above those that rise up <S%H6965><s%> against me: thou hast delivered <S%H5337><s%> me from the violent <S%H2555><s%> man <S%H376><s%>. violent: Heb. man of violence
Therefore will I give thanks <S%H3034><s%> unto thee, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, among the heathen <S%H1471><s%>, and sing praises <S%H2167><s%> unto thy name <S%H8034><s%>. give: or, confess

Great <S%H1431><s%> deliverance <S%H3444><s%> giveth he to his king <S%H4428><s%>; and sheweth <S%H6213><s%> mercy <S%H2617><s%> to his anointed <S%H4899><s%>, to David <S%H1732><s%>, and to his seed <S%H2233><s%> for <S%H5704><s%> evermore <S%H5769><s%>.
